title: Shouting erupts after Texas GOP approve new congressional maps
description: Early Saturday morning, the Texas Senate approved new congressional maps designed to help Republicans win up to five more House seats in next year’s midterm elections. This marked the final legislative hurdle for the redistricting plan endorsed by President Donald Trump and Gov. Greg Abbott.
content:
Former aide to NYC mayor gives reporter cash in bag of chips An indictment of New York City Mayor Eric Adams’ former top advisor came a day after another member of Adams’ inner circle became embroiled in a bizarre apparent bribery attempt involving a news reporter and an empty bag of potato chips. CNN’s Gloria Pazmino reports on the back-to-back incidents as Adams seeks reelection. Former aide to NYC mayor gives reporter cash in bag of chips

Trump: ‘I know more about grass than any human being’ At a meet-and-greet with law enforcement in Washington, DC, Trump vowed to re-turf the capital’s parks, declaring that no one knows more about grass than him. Trump: ‘I know more about grass than any human being’

Two brothers from Mexico were arrested by federal agents on Friday in Norwalk, Connecticut. Video shows two officers aggressively tugging Leonel Chavez’s arm while he sits inside a car before saying he is under arrest. A second video filmed by a passerby shows Chavez's brother, Ricardo, running away from an agent before getting tased, prompting him to suddenly collapse on the ground. The DHS told CNN in a statement that ICE agents were operating in Norwalk last week, but they did not specify whether it was ICE officers who arrested the Chavez brothers.

Trump refers to himself as a 'war hero' when calling Netanyahu one During an interview on “The Mark Levin Show,” President Donald Trump called Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu a “war hero” and said he is one too after US strikes on Iranian nuclear sites earlier this year. Former GOP Rep. Adam Kinzinger joins CNN's Erin Burnett to discuss. Trump refers to himself as a 'war hero' when calling Netanyahu one

Russian state TV gave a positive coverage of the outcome of the Trump-Putin summit in Alaska, celebrating the handshake between the two leaders. Russian officials also stated that the meeting resulted in progress on sanctions and opened up room for future negotiations. CNN’s Fred Pleitgen reports.
summary: An indictment has been filed for New York City Mayor Eric Adams' former top advisor, Michael Wolinsky, following a bizarre bribery attempt involving a reporter and an empty bag of potato chips. The incidents occurred during Wolinsky's campaign for reelection. Meanwhile, two brothers from Mexico were arrested by federal agents in Norwalk, Connecticut. President Donald Trump referred to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu as a "war hero" during an interview with "The Mark Levin Show". The Russian government praised the outcome of the Trump-Putin summit, which led to progress on sanctions and potential for future negotiations.
shortSummary: Former NYC mayor Eric Adams' aide allegedly bribed a reporter with a bag of chips, while two brothers were arrested in Norwalk.

Examining Melania Trump’s relative absence from Washington
Melania Trump hadn’t been spotted at the White House for more than a month. But as her husband prepared for a high-stakes Alaska summit with his Russian counterpart in pursuit of an end to the war in Ukraine, the first lady was practicing diplomacy.

Read full transcript of the interview
The Department of Justice on Friday released a transcript of the two-day interview that Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche conducted with longtime Jeffrey Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell earlier this summer.

Audio transcript reveals Maxwell struggled to remember decades-old events with Epstein

The Justice Department has released a transcript of the interview that Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche conducted with Jeffrey Epstein accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell. According to the transcripts released, she frequently told Blanche that she didn’t remember details of her conversations with Epstein
Inside the Trump team’s debate on what to release from the Epstein files
Controversy over the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein files had dogged the Trump administration for weeks. So as Congress went on their typical August recess, President Donald Trump’s team began discussing ways they could finally get ahead of the story.

DOJ did not promise Maxwell ‘anything’ in exchange for meeting, transcript says
1:27
The Justice Department has released a transcript of the interview that Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche conducted with Jeffrey Epstein accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell. According to the transcripts released, the Justice Department gave Maxwell limited immunity so that she could discuss her criminal case, but did not promise any other benefits in exchange for her testimony

argos_summary: Former top aide to NYC Mayor Eric Adams has been indicted, and a separate incident saw a reporter allegedly offered cash in a bag of potato chips in a bizarre bribery attempt. These events unfolded back‑to‑back as Adams campaigns for reelection. The article also references unrelated CNN pieces on Trump, ICE arrests, and other political stories, but the focus remains on the mayor’s aide indictment and the chip‑cash bribery claim.
